body:
I'm another victim of quietly using `DATABASE_URL` when it's present.

This was brought to my attention when I tried to tweak the connection pool size for a background worker (Sidekiq) during its initialization:

```ruby
ActiveRecord::Base.configurations[Rails.env]['pool'] = ENV['SIDEKIQ_CONCURRENCY']
```

and found that the `ActiveRecord::Base.configurations` hash was empty on production (Heroku), but perfectly fine locally in development and test. After [much digging](https://github.com/mperham/sidekiq/issues/503#issuecomment-11862427) I found that `ActiveRecord::Base.establish_connection` automatically picking up `DATABASE_URL` results in the `configurations` hash never being set, so we can't alter it for one process (worker) vs another (Rails app).

Further more, if we want to keep dev/test/prod parity (as much as possible) we need to have `DATABASE_URL` configured for both development and test, which means hand-rolling some custom configuration/setup lest we clobber our development DB when running tests (as @tpope alluded to).

An idea: What about allowing users to opt in/out of automagically picking up the `DATABASE_URL`?

Edit: For posterity, a long discussion on how I came across this is at mperham/sidekiq#503
